review: Google really surprised everyone when it came out with the Chromecast. Although it is marketed toward college students, it really doesn't work well with networks that require login/password combos.Pros:Works beautifully with the approved apps: Netflix, YouTube, HBO Go, etc.Can be run by almost any device in your house (phone, tablet, computer)Seamlessly allows anyone on the same network to send videos (great for parties)Cons:The pulsing light is REALLY BRIGHTStill a short list of apps that are approved to work with itA more seamless way to play videos that are downloaded would be appreciatedFor the price, you won't find anything that compares and works with so many other devices. Keep it up Google!
author: RBrandon "Grimm147"

review: Google keeps nuking any app that allows local file streaming from a tablet or computer to the chromecast. I think I'll probably just buy a roku.
